person.persName: James William Lindsay (Scott County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Mary E. Lindsay. Attended school in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from August 9, 1861, to May 9, 1865. Wounded at the Battle of Chickamauga, Walker County, Georgia, on September 20, 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government in Davidson County, Tennessee, on May 20, 1865.
